results:
Based on my search results, I can provide you with information about Polish editions and translations of "Folwark zwierzęcy" (Animal Farm) by George Orwell:

## Teresa Jeleńska Translation

The first Polish edition translated by Teresa Jeleńska was published in exile in London in 1947 under the title "Zwierzęcy folwark". Teresa Jeleńska was responsible for the first emigrant translation.

Several editions with Teresa Jeleńska's translation include:
- Warsaw: Niezależnej Oficyny Wydawniczej; Zapis i Puls, 1979 - a samizdat edition
- Kraków, 1985, Oficyna Literacka - an underground publishing house edition with illustrations by Jan Lebenstein
- London 1974, Odnowa - another emigrant edition

The first Polish edition translated by Teresa Jeleńska was published in exile in London in 1947 under the title "Zwierzęcy folwark".

## Magdalena Słysz Translation

I could not find any search results confirming a translation of "Folwark zwierzęcy" by Magdalena Słysz in my searches.

## Publishers

### PIW (Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy)
I did not find specific information about PIW editions of "Folwark zwierzęcy" in the search results.

### Świat Książki
Świat Książki has published a collector's edition of "Folwark zwierzęcy", noting that tens of millions of copies have been printed worldwide since then, and the British Book Marketing Council included Animal Farm among the twelve most outstanding works of contemporary times. However, the search results don't specify which translator's version Świat Książki used.

## Additional Notes

Bartłomiej Zborski is mentioned as the author of the first domestic (non-emigrant) Polish translation of the Farm, though this appears to be separate from the Teresa Jeleńska and any potential Magdalena Słysz translations you asked about.

The book was censored in Poland for many years during the communist period, which is why many early Polish editions were published in exile or by underground publishers.
